wiki_catalogs.name: Project Overview
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the vi/validation project overview section. Explain the library's purpose as a high-performance PHP validation solution optimized for large datasets with Laravel integration. Document its core philosophy of 'compile-once, validate-many' semantics, performance characteristics, and target use cases. Include architectural overview showing the relationship between SchemaValidator, ValidatorEngine, and RuleRegistry components. Provide practical examples demonstrating the performance benefits over traditional validation approaches. Document system requirements, PHP version compatibility, and Laravel integration capabilities. Use terminology consistent with the codebase and explain the library's position in the PHP validation ecosystem.

wiki_catalogs.name: Basic Field Definition
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for basic field definition in vi/validation schema. Document the fundamental field creation process using the SchemaBuilder::field() method, field naming conventions, and basic rule application syntax. Explain field definition chaining patterns, rule ordering importance, and basic validation rule integration. Include practical examples of simple field definitions for common data types (strings, integers, booleans). Cover field existence checking, default values, and basic error handling. Address field naming best practices and common pitfalls in field definition.

wiki_catalogs.name: Execution Pipeline
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed content for the validation execution pipeline architecture. Document the step-by-step validation process from schema traversal to rule application. Explain the main execution loop in ValidatorEngine::validate(), field processing order, and conditional validation logic. Cover the integration with CompiledSchema for field iteration, DataHelper for value extraction, and the overall flow from input data to validation results. Include technical details about field exclusion handling, sometimes rule processing, and empty value detection. Document performance characteristics of the execution pipeline and optimization strategies used.

wiki_catalogs.name: Schema Compilation
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content explaining the schema compilation process in vi/validation. Document how SchemaBuilder transforms rule definitions into CompiledSchema objects. Explain the compilation lifecycle from raw rule arrays to optimized compiled representations. Detail the role of ValidatorCompiler and NativeCompiler in generating high-performance validation code. Cover the compile-once-validate-many paradigm and its performance benefits. Include examples showing schema definition syntax, compilation process, and generated code structure. Address schema caching mechanisms, precompilation strategies, and native code generation. Explain how compiled schemas optimize validation performance by eliminating runtime parsing overhead.

wiki_catalogs.name: Rule Architecture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the rule architecture foundation. Document the RuleInterface contract defining the standard validation rule API, including execute() method signature, parameter handling, and return value specifications. Explain the RuleRegistry central management system with its registration mechanisms, metadata caching, and conflict resolution. Cover the RuleName attribute system for automatic rule naming and aliasing. Document the RuleId enumeration for internal rule identification. Include practical examples of rule registration, resolution, and lifecycle management. Address performance considerations for rule lookup and instantiation.

wiki_catalogs.name: Service Provider Setup
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for Laravel service provider setup and registration. Document the FastValidationServiceProvider class implementation, singleton bindings for RuleRegistry and FastValidatorFactory, and automatic rule registration. Explain the service provider lifecycle (register/boot methods), configuration publishing process, and dependency injection patterns. Cover the service provider registration in Laravel's config/app.php, package discovery configuration, and manual registration alternatives. Include practical examples of service provider initialization, configuration loading, and integration with Laravel's IoC container. Address common setup issues and troubleshooting steps.

wiki_catalogs.name: validateMany Method
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed content for the validateMany method in vi/validation. Explain how this method processes multiple records efficiently by returning all validation results as an array. Document the method signature, parameter types, and return value specifications. Highlight the memory implications of materializing all results in memory and provide guidance on when to use this method versus streaming alternatives. Include practical examples demonstrating batch validation of arrays, collections, and generators. Cover performance considerations, memory usage patterns, and best practices for handling large datasets with validateMany. Address common use cases such as CSV imports, API batch processing, and data transformation workflows.

wiki_catalogs.name: Schema Caching
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for schema caching mechanisms in vi/validation. Document the SchemaCacheInterface contract and its implementations including ArraySchemaCache for in-memory caching and FileSchemaCache for persistent storage. Explain cache key generation strategies, cache invalidation policies, and memory management techniques. Cover cache configuration options, TTL settings, and cache warming strategies. Include practical examples of cache usage patterns, performance benchmarks comparing cached vs non-cached validation, and best practices for cache sizing in different deployment scenarios.

wiki_catalogs.name: Message Resolution System
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the message resolution system. Document the MessageResolver class functionality including custom message precedence (field.rule format vs rule-level), translation fallback mechanisms, and parameter replacement logic. Explain the resolution order: custom field-specific messages, custom rule-level messages, translated messages, and attribute replacement patterns. Cover type-specific rule handling for min/max/size/between rules, parameter interpolation with :key formatting, and attribute name formatting. Include practical examples of custom message configuration, parameter passing, and debugging resolved messages.

wiki_catalogs.name: Stateless Validation
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for StatelessValidator functionality that ensures state isolation in long-running processes. Explain how StatelessValidator wraps ValidatorEngine to prevent state leakage between requests, including automatic context management through ContextManager. Document the lifecycle methods (onWorkerStart, onRequestStart, onRequestEnd, onWorkerStop) and their role in maintaining clean state boundaries. Provide practical examples of implementing stateless validation in production environments, including proper initialization patterns and resource cleanup. Address common pitfalls in state management and best practices for avoiding memory leaks in concurrent environments.

wiki_catalogs.name: Core API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive API documentation for the core validation APIs. Document the main Validator facade class with its static schema() method, SchemaValidator class with validation methods (validate, validateMany, stream, each), and SchemaBuilder API for defining validation schemas. Include method signatures, parameter specifications, return types, exception handling, and practical usage examples. Document the complete validation lifecycle from schema definition to result processing. Provide code examples demonstrating basic validation, batch processing, and streaming validation patterns.

wiki_catalogs.name: Unit Testing
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for unit testing strategies in vi/validation. Document PHPUnit configuration and test organization patterns. Explain testing individual components like Validator, RuleRegistry, Cache systems, and Message handling. Cover test case writing for validation rules, schema compilation, and execution engine functionality. Include examples of testing custom rules, validation logic, and error handling scenarios. Document mocking strategies for external dependencies, test fixtures, and assertion patterns used throughout the codebase.

wiki_catalogs.name: Core Rules
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for core validation rules that form the foundation of all validations. Document RequiredRule (mandatory field validation), NullableRule (allows null values), FilledRule (requires non-empty values), PresentRule (field must be present), and BailRule (stops validation on first failure). Explain rule syntax, parameter requirements, validation logic, and practical usage examples. Include performance characteristics and common use cases in form validation scenarios.

wiki_catalogs.name: Getting Started
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive getting started content for vi/validation library. Include detailed installation instructions via Composer, Laravel service provider registration, and configuration setup. Document the quickest path to validation using both standalone PHP usage and Laravel integration modes. Provide step-by-step examples for basic schema definition, single record validation, and error handling. Include practical examples showing the difference between parallel and override Laravel modes. Document environment requirements, dependency management, and initial setup verification. Make content accessible to developers new to the library while providing clear next steps for deeper exploration.

wiki_catalogs.name: Nested Fields and Arrays
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for nested field definitions and array handling in vi/validation schemas. Document dot notation syntax for nested object fields, array field definitions, and complex nested structures. Explain recursive field validation, array item validation, and nested object validation patterns. Include examples of multi-level nested objects, arrays of objects, and mixed nested structures. Cover validation context for nested fields, error reporting for nested structures, and performance considerations for deeply nested schemas. Address common use cases like form data with nested sections and API response validation.

wiki_catalogs.name: Context Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the ValidationContext management system. Document the ValidationContext class responsibilities for maintaining execution state, managing shared resources, and coordinating between validation components. Explain data binding mechanisms, field value access patterns, and context lifecycle management. Cover the integration with DataHelper for efficient data retrieval, context initialization for each validation run, and state management during batch processing. Include details about database validator injection, password hasher integration, and context reuse patterns for performance optimization.

wiki_catalogs.name: Validation Lifecycle
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content explaining the complete validation lifecycle from data input to result processing. Document the step-by-step process of how data flows through the validation system, including schema loading, rule execution, error collection, and result formatting. Explain the relationship between SchemaValidator, ValidatorEngine, and ValidationResult components. Cover the execution context management, short-circuit evaluation, and early termination strategies. Include timing diagrams showing data flow and component interactions. Detail how validation handles nested fields, conditional rules, and complex validation scenarios. Address performance optimization techniques used during the validation lifecycle.

wiki_catalogs.name: Built-in Rules Catalog
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for the complete catalog of 60+ built-in validation rules. Organize rules by category: core rules (required, nullable, filled, present), type rules (string, integer, numeric, boolean, array, date, json), string validation rules (email, alpha, url, uuid, ip, regex), size rules (min, max, size, between), comparison rules (in, not_in, confirmed, same, different), date comparison rules (after, before, etc.), array rules (distinct), file rules (file, image, mimes, max_file_size), acceptance rules (accepted, declined), and conditional rules (required_if, required_unless, etc.). For each rule category, document rule syntax, parameters, validation logic, and practical usage examples. Include performance characteristics and common use cases.

wiki_catalogs.name: Parallel Mode
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for parallel mode Laravel integration. Document the parallel execution model, FastValidatorFactory usage patterns, and FastValidator facade functionality. Explain how parallel mode differs from override mode, performance benefits, and use case scenarios. Cover configuration options in fast-validation.php for parallel mode, including worker pool settings, memory management, and concurrency controls. Include practical examples of parallel validation workflows, batch processing patterns, and integration with Laravel controllers and jobs. Document error handling, result collection, and performance monitoring in parallel mode. Address limitations, best practices, and troubleshooting parallel mode issues.

wiki_catalogs.name: Streaming Validation
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed content for streaming validation capabilities using stream() and each() methods in vi/validation. Document the Generator-based approach for memory-efficient batch processing, explaining how PHP's garbage collector can free memory after each processed result. Detail the stream() method for yielding results one at a time and the each() method for immediate callback processing. Include comprehensive examples showing ETL pipelines, queue processing, and large file imports. Explain the performance benefits over validateMany, memory usage comparisons, and when to choose streaming over materialized results. Cover error handling in streaming contexts, result indexing, and integration with external systems.

wiki_catalogs.name: Native Code Compilation
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for native code compilation features in vi/validation. Document the NativeCompiler implementation that generates optimized PHP code from compiled schemas. Explain the compilation process, generated code structure, and runtime performance benefits. Cover PrecompiledValidator usage for loading previously compiled schemas, atomic file writing mechanisms, and cache path management. Include examples of compilation workflows, performance improvements achieved through native compilation, and troubleshooting compilation issues. Document the relationship between schema compilation and native code generation.

wiki_catalogs.name: Translation and Localization
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the translation and localization system. Document the Translator implementation, built-in language support (English and Arabic), and language resource loading. Explain translation key resolution, message templates, and locale-specific formatting. Cover the TranslatorInterface contract, custom translator implementation, and integration with external translation systems. Include examples of adding new languages, customizing existing translations, and handling pluralization. Document best practices for maintaining translations, managing translation keys, and implementing custom localization strategies.

wiki_catalogs.name: Validator Pooling
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed documentation for ValidatorPool implementation that enables connection pooling and resource reuse in high-concurrency scenarios. Explain pool management strategies, validator lifecycle within the pool, and thread-safe operations. Document configuration options for pool size, timeout settings, and resource limits. Include practical examples of pool initialization, validator acquisition/release patterns, and monitoring pool health. Address performance benefits, memory optimization techniques, and troubleshooting pool-related issues such as timeouts and resource exhaustion.

wiki_catalogs.name: Laravel Integration API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed API documentation for Laravel-specific integration components. Document FastValidatorFactory methods for creating validators in Laravel applications, FastValidator facade usage, LaravelValidatorAdapter for adapter pattern implementation, and FastValidatorWrapper for enhanced functionality. Include Laravel service provider registration, configuration options, and integration patterns. Provide examples of parallel mode, override mode, and Octane compatibility. Document facade methods, configuration parameters, and Laravel-specific validation behaviors.

wiki_catalogs.name: Integration Testing
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for integration testing approaches in vi/validation. Document end-to-end testing strategies that validate the complete validation pipeline from schema definition to result processing. Explain testing Laravel integration scenarios, batch validation workflows, and multi-rule validation chains. Include examples of testing real-world validation scenarios, error propagation through the system, and performance characteristics under load. Cover testing edge cases, boundary conditions, and integration points with external systems.

wiki_catalogs.name: Type Rules
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for type validation rules that ensure data type conformity. Document StringTypeRule (string validation), IntegerTypeRule (integer validation), NumericRule (numeric validation), BooleanRule (boolean validation), ArrayRule (array validation), DateRule (date validation), and JsonRule (JSON validation). Explain type checking mechanisms, conversion behaviors, validation logic, and practical usage examples. Include performance considerations and type coercion rules.

wiki_catalogs.name: Core Concepts
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed content explaining the fundamental concepts of vi/validation library. Document the Schema compilation process, ValidatorEngine architecture, and CompiledSchema representation. Explain the validation lifecycle from schema definition to result processing. Cover memory management strategies, performance optimization techniques, and the compile-once-validate-many paradigm. Detail the relationship between SchemaBuilder, CompiledSchema, and ValidatorEngine components. Include conceptual diagrams illustrating data flow and component interactions. Address nested field support (up to 2 levels), nullable field handling, and short-circuit evaluation. Provide examples demonstrating how these concepts work together in practice.

wiki_catalogs.name: Conditional Validation Rules
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for conditional validation rules in vi/validation schemas. Document conditional required rules (required_if, required_unless, required_with), conditional presence rules (present_if, missing_if), and context-dependent validation patterns. Explain rule dependency chains, dynamic validation logic, and conditional rule evaluation order. Include practical examples of form validation with conditional fields, business rule-based validation, and user-driven validation scenarios. Cover performance implications of conditional rules and optimization strategies for complex conditional logic.

wiki_catalogs.name: Result Handling
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed content for the validation result handling system. Document the ValidationResult class structure for capturing and organizing validation outcomes, including success indicators, error collections, and processed data. Explain the ErrorCollector mechanism for aggregating validation failures, error categorization by field and rule type, and result formatting for different use cases. Cover result serialization, memory-efficient error storage, and integration with message resolution systems. Include technical details about result filtering, partial validation results, and performance optimization in result collection.

wiki_catalogs.name: Memory Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed content explaining memory management strategies in vi/validation for handling large datasets efficiently. Document the three main memory management approaches: in-memory validation (validateMany), streaming validation (stream/each), and chunked processing. Explain how each approach manages memory usage and prevents memory exhaustion with large datasets. Cover the Generator-based streaming implementation and its benefits for ETL processes and batch imports. Detail the ValidatorPool mechanism for reusing validators in long-running processes. Include practical examples showing memory usage patterns, performance comparisons, and best practices for different use cases. Address garbage collection, memory leaks prevention, and optimal memory allocation strategies.

wiki_catalogs.name: Custom Rule Development
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for creating custom validation rules. Document the RuleInterface implementation requirements, including proper parameter handling, validation logic implementation, and error message generation. Explain the RuleName attribute usage for automatic registration and aliasing. Cover rule parameter parsing, dependency injection, and context-aware validation. Include step-by-step examples of developing custom rules from simple closures to complex class-based implementations. Document best practices for rule performance optimization, memory management, and error handling. Address rule testing strategies and integration with the RuleRegistry system.

wiki_catalogs.name: Override Mode
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for override mode Laravel integration. Document the automatic Laravel Validator replacement mechanism, LaravelValidatorAdapter implementation, and transparent integration approach. Explain how override mode seamlessly replaces Laravel's default validator without code changes, configuration requirements, and compatibility considerations. Cover the override process in FastValidationServiceProvider, adapter pattern implementation, and backward compatibility maintenance. Include practical examples of override mode activation, existing Laravel validation code compatibility, and migration from built-in validator. Document limitations, performance implications, and troubleshooting override mode issues. Address when to choose override mode versus parallel mode.

wiki_catalogs.name: Fail-Fast Validation
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed content for fail-fast validation using firstFailure() and allValid() methods in vi/validation. Explain the concept of early termination validation where processing stops at the first error encounter. Document the firstFailure() method for retrieving the first failed validation result and the allValid() method for checking if all rows pass validation without storing results. Include practical examples demonstrating validation workflows where early termination saves significant processing time and resources. Cover use cases such as data quality checks, import validation, and real-time data processing. Explain the performance advantages over full validation, memory efficiency benefits, and integration patterns with error reporting systems.

wiki_catalogs.name: Memory Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed content for memory management optimization techniques in vi/validation. Document chunked validation strategies through ChunkedValidator for processing large datasets without memory overflow. Explain validator pooling via ValidatorPool for resource reuse in high-throughput scenarios. Cover stateless validation patterns for memory-efficient processing and garbage collection optimization. Include practical examples of memory profiling, heap usage monitoring, and optimization techniques for different data sizes. Document best practices for memory-constrained environments and long-running processes.

wiki_catalogs.name: Error Collection and Aggregation
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for error collection and aggregation mechanisms. Document the MessageBag class functionality for collecting, organizing, and accessing validation errors. Explain error aggregation patterns, nested field error handling, and batch validation error management. Cover the ErrorCollector integration, ValidationResult integration, and error formatting for different output formats. Include examples of error collection strategies, custom error aggregation patterns, and error reporting mechanisms. Document error filtering, sorting, and transformation for different use cases.

wiki_catalogs.name: Runtime Context Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for ContextManager that handles runtime context switching and state management across different execution environments. Explain context lifecycle management, environment detection mechanisms, and state isolation strategies. Document the RuntimeAwareInterface contract and how components register for runtime notifications. Include examples of custom context providers, context switching patterns, and debugging context-related issues. Address memory management, cleanup procedures, and best practices for maintaining context consistency in distributed and concurrent environments.

wiki_catalogs.name: Rule System API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive API documentation for the rule system interfaces and registry. Document RuleRegistry methods for managing custom rules, RuleInterface specification for rule implementation, RuleName and RuleId classes for rule identification. Include examples of registering custom rules, implementing rule interfaces, and accessing registered rules. Document rule registration patterns, rule metadata handling, and integration with the validation engine. Provide guidelines for extending the rule system with custom validation logic.

wiki_catalogs.name: Performance Benchmarking
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed content for performance benchmarking tools and methodologies in vi/validation. Document the benchmarking suite including benchmark.php, benchmark_new_rules.php, and final_benchmark.php scripts. Explain performance measurement techniques, benchmark result interpretation, and optimization validation strategies. Cover memory usage tracking, validation throughput measurement, and comparative analysis with Laravel's built-in validator. Include examples of running benchmarks, interpreting results, and identifying performance bottlenecks in validation workflows.

wiki_catalogs.name: String Validation Rules
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for comprehensive string validation rules. Document EmailRule (email format validation), AlphaRule (alphabetic characters), AlphaDashRule (alphanumeric + dashes), AlphanumericRule (letters and numbers), AsciiRule (ASCII characters), UrlRule (URL validation), UlidRule and UuidRule (unique identifiers), MacAddressRule (MAC address validation), TimezoneRule (timezone validation), LanguageRule and CountryRule (geographic validation), ExtensionsRule (file extensions), RegexRule and NotRegexRule (pattern matching), StartsWithRule and EndsWithRule (prefix/suffix validation), and case rules (LowercaseRule, UppercaseRule). Explain validation algorithms, pattern matching, locale considerations, and practical usage examples.

wiki_catalogs.name: Schema Definition
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for schema definition in vi/validation. Document the SchemaBuilder API with detailed field definition syntax, nested field support using dot notation, and conditional validation rules. Explain field chaining patterns, rule application order, and validation context. Cover advanced schema features including conditional required rules, missing field validation, and field presence checking. Include practical examples demonstrating complex schema construction for real-world scenarios. Document schema compilation process, optimization benefits, and reuse patterns. Address schema versioning, inheritance patterns, and best practices for maintainable validation logic.

wiki_catalogs.name: Schema Compilation and Optimization
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for schema compilation process and optimization in vi/validation. Document the compilation pipeline from SchemaBuilder to CompiledSchema, optimization benefits, and performance improvements. Explain compiled schema caching, precompilation strategies, and schema reuse patterns. Cover compilation metadata, rule optimization during compilation, and memory efficiency gains. Include examples of schema compilation workflows, caching strategies, and performance benchmarking. Address compilation errors, debugging compiled schemas, and best practices for schema optimization.

wiki_catalogs.name: Performance Optimizations
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for performance optimization techniques in the validation engine. Document fail-fast execution strategies, early termination conditions, and memory management during validation. Explain the impact of CompiledSchema optimization on validation speed, rule application shortcuts, and short-circuit evaluation patterns. Cover max errors limiting, implicit rule detection for skipping empty values, and performance characteristics of different validation scenarios. Include benchmarking data, optimization trade-offs, and best practices for high-throughput validation workloads.

wiki_catalogs.name: Performance Optimization
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop comprehensive content covering performance optimization techniques in vi/validation. Document the native code compilation system that generates high-performance validation functions. Explain how NativeCompiler converts rule arrays into optimized PHP closures for maximum speed. Cover schema caching strategies using ArraySchemaCache and FileSchemaCache for reducing compilation overhead. Detail the precompilation process and its impact on startup performance. Include benchmark comparisons between different validation approaches and configuration options. Explain how the library achieves superior performance through compile-time optimization, caching, and efficient data structures. Address profiling techniques, performance monitoring, and optimization best practices for production environments.

wiki_catalogs.name: Rule Parsing and Resolution
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for rule parsing from Laravel-style strings to executable rule instances. Document the LaravelRuleParser implementation for converting string-based rules into rule objects. Explain rule syntax parsing, parameter extraction, and rule chain processing. Cover the LaravelValidatorAdapter integration for seamless Laravel validation compatibility. Include examples of complex rule combinations, conditional rule parsing, and parameter binding. Document error handling for malformed rule strings and unsupported rule combinations. Address performance considerations for rule parsing and resolution in high-throughput scenarios.

wiki_catalogs.name: Configuration Options
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for Laravel integration configuration options. Document all configuration parameters in fast-validation.php including mode selection (parallel vs override), worker pool settings, memory management options, and performance tuning parameters. Explain environment variable overrides, configuration precedence, and deployment-specific configurations. Cover cache configuration options, logging settings, and debugging parameters. Include practical examples of different configuration scenarios, environment-specific setups, and production deployment configurations. Document configuration validation, default values, and recommended settings for different use cases. Address configuration troubleshooting and best practices for various deployment environments.

wiki_catalogs.name: Chunked Processing
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed content for chunked processing capabilities in vi/validation using ChunkedValidator. Explain how chunked validation processes large datasets in controlled batches to manage memory usage and processing time. Document the ChunkedValidator class, its configuration options, and integration with the main SchemaValidator. Include examples demonstrating chunk size optimization, memory management strategies, and progress tracking for large-scale data processing. Cover use cases such as database migrations, bulk data updates, and long-running batch operations. Explain chunk boundaries, error handling across chunks, and recovery mechanisms for interrupted processing. Address performance tuning, optimal chunk sizes for different data volumes, and monitoring chunk processing progress.

wiki_catalogs.name: Benchmarking and Performance Tools
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop comprehensive content for benchmarking and performance measurement tools in vi/validation. Document the benchmark suite including benchmark.php for basic performance testing, benchmark_new_rules.php for rule-specific testing, and final_benchmark.php for comprehensive performance analysis. Explain performance measurement methodologies, statistical analysis of validation throughput, and comparison metrics against standard Laravel validation. Include examples of running benchmarks, interpreting results, identifying performance bottlenecks, and optimizing validation pipelines based on benchmark data.

wiki_catalogs.name: Worker Process Adapters
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop comprehensive documentation for worker process adapters that enable long-running process support across different server environments. Document RoadRunnerAdapter for RoadRunner workers, SwooleAdapter for Swoole environments, and OctaneValidatorProvider for Laravel Octane integration. Explain adapter initialization, lifecycle management, and environment-specific optimizations. Include configuration examples for each adapter, deployment patterns, and performance tuning recommendations. Address common integration challenges, debugging techniques, and troubleshooting worker process issues in production environments.

wiki_catalogs.name: Execution Engine API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed API documentation for the validation execution engine components. Document ValidatorEngine class methods, ValidationContext for execution state management, ValidationResult for result handling, and ErrorCollector for error aggregation. Include execution pipeline methods, context manipulation, result processing, and error collection patterns. Provide examples of programmatic validation execution, custom result handling, and error processing workflows. Document internal APIs used by the validation engine and their integration points.

wiki_catalogs.name: Correctness Verification
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop comprehensive content for correctness verification and validation accuracy testing in vi/validation. Document parity checking mechanisms that ensure validation results match Laravel's built-in validator. Explain fuzz testing strategies using fuzz_mismatches.php to identify edge cases and validation inconsistencies. Cover correctness verification workflows, test data generation, and automated validation accuracy checks. Include examples of validating rule implementations, ensuring backward compatibility, and maintaining validation precision across different data types and scenarios.

wiki_catalogs.name: Size and Comparison Rules
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for size and comparison validation rules. Document BetweenRule (value range validation), MinRule and MaxRule (minimum/maximum bounds), SizeRule (exact size validation), DigitsRule and DigitsBetweenRule (digit count validation), Comparison rules (GreaterThan, GreaterThanOrEqual, LessThan, LessThanOrEqual), MultipleOfRule (divisibility validation), DecimalRule (decimal precision), and file size rules (MinFileSizeRule, MaxFileSizeRule). Explain boundary checking, numeric comparison logic, precision handling, and practical usage examples in form validation and data processing scenarios.

wiki_catalogs.name: Validation Engine
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed content for the validation engine architecture and operation. Document the ValidatorEngine class responsibilities, execution pipeline, and performance optimizations. Explain ValidationContext role in maintaining execution state, ValidationResult structure for capturing outcomes, and ErrorCollector mechanism for aggregating validation failures. Cover execution strategies for single records, batch processing, and streaming validation. Document memory management during validation, short-circuit evaluation, and error collection patterns. Include technical details about the validation algorithm, performance characteristics, and optimization techniques used in the engine.

wiki_catalogs.name: Octane Compatibility
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for Laravel Octane compatibility and long-running process support. Document the OctaneValidatorProvider implementation, validator pooling mechanisms, and stateless validation patterns. Explain how the library maintains compatibility with Laravel Octane's persistent process model, memory management in long-running contexts, and connection pooling strategies. Cover validator lifecycle management, pool configuration, and resource cleanup in Octane environments. Include practical examples of Octane deployment configurations, performance optimization techniques, and troubleshooting Octane-specific issues. Document integration with Octane's preloading, hot reload, and process management features. Address best practices for production Octane deployments and monitoring long-running processes.

wiki_catalogs.name: Failure Collection
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed content for failure collection and aggregation in vi/validation using the failures() method and BatchValidationResult. Explain how to efficiently collect and process only failed validation results without storing successful validations. Document the failures() generator method for streaming-only-failures processing and the BatchValidationResult class for aggregated batch validation outcomes. Include examples demonstrating error reporting for batch imports, data quality assessment, and corrective action workflows. Cover memory efficiency benefits of selective failure collection, result indexing preservation, and integration with logging and notification systems. Explain use cases such as data cleaning pipelines, compliance checking, and quality assurance processes.

wiki_catalogs.name: Array and Database Rules
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for array and database validation rules. Document ArrayRule (array validation), DistinctRule (unique array elements), ListRule (list validation), database rules (ExistsRule for existence checks, UniqueRule for uniqueness), membership rules (InRule, NotInRule), and array key rules (RequiredArrayKeysRule). Explain array traversal, database query patterns, constraint checking, and practical usage examples in complex data validation scenarios.

wiki_catalogs.name: Rule System
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the rule system architecture and built-in rules. Document the RuleRegistry central management system, RuleInterface contract, and rule categorization. Explain the complete catalog of 60+ built-in rules organized by category (core, type, string, size, comparison, date, acceptance, array, file). Cover rule registration process, custom rule development, and rule attribute management. Document rule parsing from Laravel-style strings, rule parameter handling, and rule execution context. Include practical examples of rule combinations, conditional rule application, and performance considerations for rule selection.

wiki_catalogs.name: Conditional and File Rules
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for conditional validation rules, file validation rules, and specialized validation rules. Document conditional rules (RequiredIfRule, RequiredUnlessRule, RequiredWithRule, etc.), exclusion rules (ExcludeRule, ProhibitedRule), acceptance rules (AcceptedRule, DeclinedRule), confirmation rules (ConfirmedRule, SameRule, DifferentRule), file rules (FileRule, ImageRule, MimesRule, DimensionsRule), web-related rules (ActiveUrlRule, UrlRule, IpRule), date rules (DateEqualsRule, AfterRule, BeforeRule, DateFormatRule), enum rules (EnumRule), password rules (PasswordRule, CurrentPasswordRule), and closure-based validation (ClosureRule). Explain conditional logic, file processing, specialized validation algorithms, and practical usage examples in complex validation scenarios.

wiki_catalogs.name: Batch Processing
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed content for batch processing capabilities in vi/validation. Document the validateMany method for processing multiple records efficiently, streaming validation with stream() and each() methods, and chunked validation for large datasets. Explain memory-efficient processing strategies, fail-fast validation with firstFailure(), and comprehensive validation with allValid(). Cover ChunkedValidator for controlled memory usage, BatchValidationResult aggregation, and performance optimization techniques. Include practical examples demonstrating different batch processing scenarios, memory usage comparisons, and best practices for handling large datasets.

wiki_catalogs.name: Laravel Integration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for Laravel integration features. Document parallel mode setup and usage, override mode configuration and limitations, and service provider registration process. Explain FastValidatorFactory usage, FastValidator facade functionality, and LaravelValidatorAdapter integration. Cover configuration options in fast-validation.php, environment variable support, and deployment considerations. Document integration with Laravel's validation ecosystem, compatibility with existing Laravel validation code, and migration strategies. Include practical examples of both parallel and override modes, error handling integration, and performance optimization in Laravel applications.

wiki_catalogs.name: Performance Optimization
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed content for performance optimization features in vi/validation. Document schema caching mechanisms including ArraySchemaCache and FileSchemaCache implementations. Explain native code compilation through NativeCompiler, precompiled validators via PrecompiledValidator, and ValidatorCompiler optimization strategies. Cover memory management techniques, garbage collection optimization, and resource pooling. Document benchmarking methodologies, performance measurement tools, and optimization best practices. Include practical examples of caching strategies, compilation workflows, and performance tuning for different use cases and environments.

wiki_catalogs.name: Error Handling and Messages
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for error handling and message system. Document MessageResolver functionality, Translator implementation for multi-language support, and MessageBag error aggregation. Explain built-in language support (English, Arabic), custom message configuration, and attribute name customization. Cover error collection patterns, message formatting, and localization best practices. Document integration with Laravel's error handling, custom error message development, and message template customization. Include practical examples of error handling strategies, internationalization implementation, and debugging validation failures.

wiki_catalogs.name: Advanced Features
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed content for advanced features supporting long-running processes and high-concurrency environments. Document StatelessValidator for state isolation, ValidatorPool for connection pooling, and ContextManager for runtime context handling. Explain OctaneValidatorProvider integration with Laravel Octane, RoadRunnerAdapter for RoadRunner workers, and SwooleAdapter for Swoole environments. Cover runtime environment detection, worker process management, and state management strategies. Include practical examples of production deployment configurations, performance monitoring, and troubleshooting long-running process issues.

wiki_catalogs.name: API Reference
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive API reference documentation for all public interfaces in vi/validation. Document method signatures, parameter specifications, return value types, and usage examples for Validator facade, SchemaValidator class, SchemaBuilder API, and RuleRegistry. Include FastValidatorFactory and FastValidator facade methods with Laravel-specific functionality. Provide complete method documentation with parameter descriptions, exception handling, and code examples. Document all public classes, interfaces, and their relationships. Include migration guides for deprecated features and version compatibility information.

wiki_catalogs.name: Testing and Benchmarking
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for testing strategies and benchmarking tools in vi/validation. Document unit testing approaches using PHPUnit, integration testing patterns, and performance testing methodologies. Explain benchmarking tools including benchmark.php, final_benchmark.php, and performance_repro.php. Cover correctness verification, parity checking against Laravel validation, and fuzz testing strategies. Document test utilities, performance measurement techniques, and continuous integration setup. Include practical examples of writing tests for custom rules, performance optimization validation, and regression testing procedures.

wiki_catalogs.name: Troubleshooting and FAQ
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive troubleshooting and FAQ content for vi/validation library. Document common issues including performance problems, memory leaks, Laravel integration challenges, and configuration errors. Provide solutions for schema compilation failures, rule parsing issues, and error message customization problems. Cover Laravel Octane compatibility issues, validator pooling problems, and production deployment troubleshooting. Include frequently asked questions about rule support, performance expectations, migration from built-in validator, and best practices. Document debugging techniques, logging strategies, and diagnostic tools for identifying and resolving validation issues.

wiki_overview.content:
<blog>

# Vi Validation: High-Performance PHP Validation Library

## Project Introduction

### Purpose Statement
Vi Validation is a high-performance PHP validation library specifically optimized for large datasets and Laravel applications. It provides a modern, efficient alternative to Laravel's built-in validation system with enhanced performance characteristics and advanced features for batch processing scenarios.

### Core Goals and Objectives
- **Performance Optimization**: Deliver significantly faster validation performance compared to traditional approaches
- **Laravel Integration**: Seamless integration with Laravel's ecosystem while maintaining independence
- **Batch Processing**: Efficient handling of large datasets with memory-conscious operations
- **Extensibility**: Flexible rule system with support for custom validation logic
- **Production Ready**: Robust caching, compilation, and runtime optimization features

### Target Audience
- Laravel developers working with large datasets
- Applications requiring high-throughput validation
- Systems processing batch imports, ETL pipelines, or queue workers
- Performance-critical applications where validation overhead matters

## Technical Architecture

The library follows a layered architecture with clear separation of concerns:

```mermaid
graph TD
    A[Laravel Integration] --> B[FastValidatorFactory]
    B --> C[SchemaBuilder]
    C --> D[CompiledSchema]
    D --> E[ValidatorEngine]
    E --> F[RuleRegistry]
    F --> G[Individual Rules]
    
    H[Cache Layer] --> I[ArraySchemaCache]
    H --> J[FileSchemaCache]
    
    K[Runtime Layer] --> L[ValidatorPool]
    K --> M[StatelessValidator]
    
    N[Messages] --> O[MessageResolver]
    N --> P[Translator]
```

### Component Breakdown

**Core Validation Engine**: The heart of the system consists of several interconnected components:

- **SchemaValidator**: Main entry point for validation operations
- **ValidatorEngine**: Executes validation rules against data
- **CompiledSchema**: Optimized schema representation for fast execution
- **RuleRegistry**: Manages rule registration and resolution

**Execution Pipeline**: Data flows through a well-defined pipeline:

```mermaid
sequenceDiagram
    participant Client
    participant SchemaValidator
    participant ValidatorEngine
    participant RuleRegistry
    participant Rules
    
    Client->>+SchemaValidator: validate(data)
    SchemaValidator->>+ValidatorEngine: validate(schema, data)
    ValidatorEngine->>+RuleRegistry: resolve rules
    RuleRegistry-->>-ValidatorEngine: rule instances
    loop For each field
        ValidatorEngine->>+Rules: validate(value)
        Rules-->>-ValidatorEngine: validation result
    end
    ValidatorEngine-->>-SchemaValidator: ValidationResult
    SchemaValidator-->>-Client: Result
```

### Design Patterns

The library employs several key design patterns:

- **Factory Pattern**: Used extensively for creating validators and rule instances
- **Registry Pattern**: Centralized rule management and resolution
- **Strategy Pattern**: Different validation strategies for various scenarios
- **Template Method**: Consistent validation workflow across different rule types
- **Command Pattern**: Individual rules encapsulate validation logic

## Key Implementation

### Main Entry Points

**Primary Interface** (`src/Validator.php`)
- Provides the main `schema()` method for building validation schemas
- Simple fluent interface for defining validation rules

**Laravel Integration** (`src/Laravel/FastValidationServiceProvider.php`)
- Registers the package with Laravel's service container
- Provides both parallel mode and override mode integration
- Supports Laravel Octane compatibility

### Core Modules

**Schema Definition** (`src/Schema/SchemaBuilder.php`)
- Fluent interface for defining field-level validation rules
- Supports complex nested structures and conditional validation
- Generates optimized `CompiledSchema` objects

**Validation Engine** (`src/Execution/ValidatorEngine.php`)
- Core validation execution logic
- Handles rule application, error collection, and performance optimizations
- Supports fail-fast mode and configurable error limits

**Rule System** (`src/Rules/RuleRegistry.php`)
- Centralized rule registration and resolution
- Supports custom rule development with metadata attributes
- Built-in registry of 60+ validation rules

### Configuration Approach

**Configuration System** (`config/fast-validation.php`)
- Environment-driven configuration with sensible defaults
- Supports multiple cache drivers (array, file)
- Performance tuning options for production environments
- Laravel-specific integration settings

### External Dependencies

**Composer Configuration** (`composer.json`)
- Requires PHP 8.1+ and Laravel 10.x/11.x validation components
- PSR-4 autoloading for clean namespace organization
- Development dependencies including PHPUnit for testing

### Integration Points

**Laravel Adapter** (`src/Laravel/LaravelValidatorAdapter.php`)
- Bridges the library with Laravel's Validator facade
- Supports both opt-in parallel mode and transparent override mode
- Maintains compatibility with existing Laravel validation workflows

**Runtime Support** (`src/Runtime/ValidatorPool.php`)
- Optimizes performance in long-running processes
- Supports Laravel Octane, Swoole, and RoadRunner environments
- Implements connection pooling for reduced instantiation overhead

### Component Relationships

```mermaid
classDiagram
    class SchemaValidator {
        +validate(data): ValidationResult
        +validateMany(rows): array
        +stream(rows): Generator
        +each(rows, callback): void
    }
    
    class ValidatorEngine {
        +validate(schema, data): ValidationResult
        +setFailFast(failFast): void
        +setMaxErrors(maxErrors): void
    }
    
    class RuleRegistry {
        +register(class): void
        +resolve(name): RuleInterface
        +registerBuiltInRules(): void
    }
    
    class CompiledSchema {
        +getFields(): array
        +getRulesArray(): array
    }
    
    SchemaValidator --> ValidatorEngine
    SchemaValidator --> CompiledSchema
    ValidatorEngine --> RuleRegistry
    CompiledSchema --> RuleRegistry
```

## Key Features

### Functionality Overview

**High-Performance Validation**
- Native code compilation for maximum speed
- Memory-efficient batch processing with streaming support
- Configurable fail-fast mode for early termination
- Advanced caching mechanisms for repeated validation

**Comprehensive Rule System**
- 60+ built-in validation rules covering all common use cases
- Support for custom rule development with metadata attributes
- Conditional validation based on field values
- Complex validation scenarios with cross-field dependencies

**Advanced Batch Processing**
- Memory-conscious validation of large datasets
- Streaming validation with generator support
- Parallel processing capabilities for multi-core systems
- Connection pooling for long-running processes

### Implementation Highlights

**Performance Optimization** (`src/Compilation/NativeCompiler.php`)
- Compiles validation schemas to native PHP code
- Eliminates reflection overhead during validation
- Atomic file writing for thread-safe operation

**Memory Management** (`src/Execution/ChunkedValidator.php`)
- Processes large datasets in configurable chunks
- Prevents memory exhaustion during batch validation
- Supports both synchronous and asynchronous processing modes

**Laravel Integration** (`src/Laravel/Facades/FastValidator.php`)
- Provides Laravel-style facade for easy integration
- Maintains compatibility with existing Laravel validation patterns
- Supports both functional and object-oriented usage styles

### Feature Architecture

```mermaid
stateDiagram-v2
    [*] --> SchemaBuilding
    SchemaBuilding --> SchemaCompilation
    SchemaCompilation --> ReadyForValidation
    
    ReadyForValidation --> SingleValidation
    ReadyForValidation --> BatchValidation
    ReadyForValidation --> StreamingValidation
    
    SingleValidation --> Complete
    BatchValidation --> Complete
    StreamingValidation --> Complete
    
    Complete --> [*]
```

The library's architecture enables seamless integration with existing Laravel applications while providing significant performance improvements for validation-heavy workloads. Its modular design allows developers to leverage individual components or use the complete validation pipeline depending on their specific needs.

**Sources:**
- [composer.json](composer.json)
- [Validator.php](src/Validator.php)
- [FastValidationServiceProvider.php](src/Laravel/FastValidationServiceProvider.php)
- [fast-validation.php](config/fast-validation.php)
- [SchemaValidator.php](src/SchemaValidator.php)
- [ValidatorEngine.php](src/Execution/ValidatorEngine.php)
- [RuleRegistry.php](src/Rules/RuleRegistry.php)
- [ValidatorCompiler.php](src/Compilation/ValidatorCompiler.php)
- [ValidatorPool.php](src/Runtime/ValidatorPool.php)
- [RuleInterface.php](src/Rules/RuleInterface.php)
- [RuleName.php](src/Rules/RuleName.php)
- [SchemaBuilder.php](src/Schema/SchemaBuilder.php)
- [FastValidatorFactory.php](src/Laravel/FastValidatorFactory.php)

</blog>
